item.title: Report I-2023060108
item.description:
Report I-2023060108

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-08
  • City: Little Mountain
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: POPE TRANSPORT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While travelling near 785 South Carolina Highway 202 the Pope Transport unit was involved in an incident which resulted in a roll-over. As a result of the roll-over approximately 20 gallons of gasoline leaked from the tanker. The local police and Fire Department responded to assess the site. First Reponders were able to stop the leak and dug a trench to contain the free liquid. First Call Environmental was dispatched to perform the remainder of the cleanup. First Call Environmental deployed absorbent material as needed and excavated the contaminated soil.

item.title: Report E-2023060431
item.description:
Report E-2023060431

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-19
  • City: N CHARLESTON
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LIQUID CARGO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1435 ET, Liquid Cargo (calling on behalf of their entity US Container Depot) requested a response to a rolled-over ISO tank of UN3267 Sodium Hydroxide that released as estimated 20-gallons. The incident occurred when the driver encountered difficulty making a U-turn. 1709 ET, Hepaco arrived on-site and began assessing the site. Hepaco reported that approximately 5-gallons of material had released to the asphalt surface, no drains or waterways were impacted. The crew used a acid gator to clean and neutralize the release area. One 55-gal DM containing impacted absorbents was generated, and properly disposed of on May 25, 2023, at Clean Management in Walterboro, SC.

item.title: Report X-2023060553
item.description:
Report X-2023060553

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-30
  • City: COLUMBIA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered damaged on route by the ISP driver. The ISP driver brought the damaged package back to the station where the admin placed the package in a lined hazmat container and relocated the contents to the hazmat cage to processed by a senior admin, DescribePack: The one damaged bottle has a cracked cap that contributed to the leak of the package. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined hazmat tote and placed in the locked hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023060498
item.description:
Report X-2023060498

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-30
  • City: SPARTANBURG
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE UNLOADED LEAKING. HAZMAT-CERTIFIED ADMIN NOTIFIED OF DAMAGED HAZMAT PACKAGE. DescribePack: BOTTLES LEAKED FROM UNDER LOOSE CAPS/BROKEN SEALS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: HAZMAT-CERTIFIED ADMIN USING PROPER PPE PLACED THE PACKAGE INSIDE A LINED HAZMAT TOTE AND SECURED THE TOTE INSIDE THE HAZMAT CAGE.

item.title: Report E-2023060160
item.description:
Report E-2023060160

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-23
  • City: TRAVELERS REST
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 23, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of UN1263 to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted surface. FCE personnel deployed absorbents to the release and worked them in using hand tools. The crew then utilized absorbent pads to remove all residual product and containerized all paint impacted material into two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.

Report X-2023060259

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Damage hazmat was discovered in trailer during unloading process then was placed inside hazmat bucket and placed in hazmat cage for further inspection. DescribePack: 1 of the 4 plastic bottles that contained the hazmat material was completely empty and dented around the top of jug due to not being placed properly. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Damage hazmat was placed into hazmat bucket

item.title: Report X-2023060254
item.description:
Report X-2023060254

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-23
  • City: SPARTANBURG
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded undamaged and placed on the incompatible conveyor belt. It was removed from the incompatible conveyor belt and placed on the floor improperly, leading to the failure of the caps. Package was immediately removed from the service flow and placed in the damaged Hazmat cage where it was repackaged in a salvage drum. DescribePack: 2x2.5L bottles of sulfuric acid, failed due to loose caps, leaking approximately 2 floz. of sulfuric acid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately removed from the service flow upon which it was placed in the damaged hazmat cage and repackaged in a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2023051212
item.description:
Report X-2023051212

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-22
  • City: COLUMBIA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered in the trailer loaded improperly by the package handler. The package handler then noticed it was leaking ant then placed the package in a lined hazmat bin. Management was alerted who then alerted the senior admin. The senior admin placed the package inside the hazmat cage for further processing. DescribePack: One of the lids of the bottles came off and leaked out contents. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a lined hazmat bin and inside the hazmat cage.
